qas.question: Who purchased the majority stake and re-marketed the product in 1980?
Was Laserdisk officially or unofficially reffered to as "Laser Videodisc"?
Did MCA produce the disc or the players after being bought out?
Who were the scientists that worked on the early research for Laserdiscs?

answers.text: Richard Wilkinson, Ray Dakin and John Winslow

qas.question: What company did the early Laserdisc researchers later found?

context: <a0_0>Pioneer Electronics<a0_0/> later purchased the majority stake in the format and marketed it as both LaserVision (format name) and LaserDisc (brand name) in 1980, with some releases <a1_0>unofficially<a1_0/> referring to the medium as "Laser Videodisc". Philips produced the players while MCA produced the <a2_0>discs<a2_0/>. The Philips-MCA cooperation was not successful, and discontinued after a few years. Several of the scientists responsible for the early research (<a3_0>Richard Wilkinson, Ray Dakin and John Winslow<a3_0/>) founded <a4_0>Optical Disc Corporation (now ODC Nimbus)<a4_0/>.
